info.description: RTS-like game where you command Ants, made for the GMTK Game Jam 2024

sections.title: Motivation:
sections.content: For the GMTK Game Jam 2024, with the theme of "Built to Scale" I decided to make a game where you can spawn and command units (Ants) that you can use to explore a map covered with a fog of war, to find other structures that you can interact with.

sections.title: Roles:
sections.content: For this game I took the role of a solo-dev, so all the code and features were done by myself with the help of free Assets for the graphics.

list.item: Spawning of units: Spawn unlimited units (Ants) with the click of a button on screen.
Selection of units:
Box Selection: Click and drag a box selection to select multiple units.
Individual Selection: Click on a single unit to select it.
Multiple Selection: Hold LeftCTRL + Click to select multiple units one at a time.
Selection of structures: Click on a structure to interact with it.
Movement of units with Pathfinding: Right Clicking on the map moves the selected units to that location avoiding obstacles and finding the best route to get there.
Camera Movement: Moving the cursor to the edges of the screen moves the camera in that direction.
Fog of War: The map is covered by two layers of fog.
Dark Fog: This fog is pitch black and gets erased when units travel through the map.

Soft Fog: This fog lets you see the map but with a faded effect, it is located under the Dark Fog layer. Units and some structures have a defined radius where you can the see the clear map underneath.
Unity: For the game engine.
Hex Tilemap System: For the map and fog of war (Dark Fog).
Input System: For the selection and command of units.
NavMesh: For the pathfinding and movement of units.
Canvas UI: For UI interaction with structures.
Sprite Mask 2D: For the Soft Fog of the fog of war.
WebGL Export: To generate a playable game in the browser.
Aseprite: To edit and create some pixel art graphics.
Autodesk Sketchbook: To create the game's cover image.

info.description: 2D top-down puzzle game, made for a week-long game jam

sections.title: Motivation:
sections.content: For the "Do you wanna Jam?! 2023" Game Jam, that ran for a week, with the theme of "Freeze" I decided to make a game where you play as "Za", a boy that has his sister "Ze" captured, and he has to go and Free her (Free Ze) by solving sokoban-like puzzles freezing melting rocks in order to push them over buttons

sections.title: Roles:
sections.content: For this game I took the role of

list.item: Programmer: Coded all system and features.
Artist: Made the character, environment and objects in pixel art.
Composer: Made two tracks for the game's music.
Top Down Movement: The player moves in four directions (Vertical and Horizontal). The movement is grid-base with smooth animations for the transition between cells
Freeze and Push: The player can freeze rocks and push them around the level, these melt over time not being able to push them until they are freezed again.
Swtich Activation: Unfreezed rocks activate the buttons on the level's floor upon contact. These are not activated by the freezed rocks or by the player.
Reset Area: Pushing the reset button (or R key) resets the area where the player is in, affecting only the puzzle in that area.
Mobile Support: The game can be played in a mobile's browser and it will detect it, showing on-screen buttons for touch interaction.
Unity: For the game engine.
Tilemap System: For the environment (ground/walls) and level design using Rule Tiles and Prefab Brushes.
New Input System: For the player's movement for keyboard and mobile.
Canvas UI: For the dialog boxes and UI.
Animation/Animator: For the player and rocks animations
WebGL Export: To generate a playable game in the browser.
Aseprite: To create pixel art graphics for Tiles, Characters, Objects and Animations.
LMMS: For the creation of the game's music.

info.description: VN Demo made for a VN focused game jam

sections.title: Motivation:
sections.content: For the "Winter Visual Novel Jam 2022" I wanted to make a system to create Visual Novel and make a small functional demo with it. So this is more like an experimental project rather than a game. The system focused on Nodes where each Node represent an entity on the Visual Novel, like a Text, a TextBox, an Image, an Event, etc.

sections.title: Roles:
sections.content: For this game I took the role of

list.item: Programmer: Coded the Node System
Artist: Made the images used for the Visual Novel
For the VN itself:
Text Display: The text appears character by character in the text boxes.
Input Progression: Clicking on the screen or pressing Space makes the text finish the sentence or continuing to the next part if it is already finished.
Text Boxes: There is 3 types of text boxes; Info Texts, Dialog Text, Narrator Text
Mobile Support: The game can be played in a mobile's browser.
For the Node System
Text Node: This Node is used for every text in the game.
Image Node: This Node is used to display images in the game.
Bool Node: This Node is used to toggle on/off elements in the game.
Composite Node: This Node is used to run two or more nodes at the same time.
Event Node: This Node is used to trigger code functions in the game.
Unity: For the game engine.
Scriptable Objects: Scriptable Objects were used for the Node System, each node was a Scriptable Object.
Editor UI: Editor Scripting was used for making edits in the Scriptable Objects objects to make them a bit more user friendly when creating them.
Canvas UI: For the elements of the game.
WebGL Export: To generate a playable game in the browser.
Autodesk Sketchbook: To create the game's images.
